title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Omaha

content.rendered:
Omaha has a rich history, but the city has changed quite a lot over the years. Looking for rooms for rent in Omaha? Here’s what you should know about finding the best neighborhoods and transit!

Related: 15 Best Things To Do In Omaha

Getting to Know Omaha

Whether you’re looking for a change, or want to explore new job opportunities, don’t be quick to strike Omaha off the list. In the center of the country, the city is not only convenient to get to but to get around in as well. When the traffic’s good, you won’t need over 20 minutes to get to your destination.

Where would you go, you ask? From famous historical sports such as the Bob Kerrey Pedestrian Bridge and the Joslyn Art Museum to explore the and up-and-coming restaurants in the city, you won’t run out of things to do in Omaha.

Related: Is It Time For You To Move To Another City?

Finding Rooms for Rent in Omaha

With living expenses being 11% less than the national average, it is easy to find cheap rooms for rent in Omaha. Most neighborhoods in the city are a mix of old and new architecture, with ample parks and outdoor areas to help you get fresh air every once in a while. The city’s rich history is reflected in renovated and century-old buildings which have stood the test of time.

Find Rooms for Rent in Omaha

Related: Fun Ideas For a Night In With Your Roommates

Top Neighborhoods in Omaha

  • Morton Meadows (Aksarben): When trying to find affordable rooms for rent in Omaha, this neighborhood is the place to look. The neighborhood is surrounded by restaurants, parks, and many other places to explore, making it perfect for those who like to be outdoors.
  • Dundee: For those who are moving to Omaha with their family, this neighborhood will be the perfect spot. Close to the city’s biggest park, Memorial Park, and acclaimed ice cream shops, you don’t want to miss out on renting in this Omaha neighborhood.
  • Blackstone District: Recently renovated centuries’ old buildings to modern apartments make up this neighborhood. Thanks to recent development efforts, Blackstone is an up-and-coming neighborhood filled with cafes, restaurants, shops, and renovated parks.

Average Rent in Omaha

University life in Omaha

The transition to University can be a stressful affair, especially when you are moving out. Most Universities in Omaha offer on-campus housing, making it easier for you to make new friends and interact with people within your campus. Omaha has several historical sites that you can explore with your roommate, and with a low cost of living, you can enjoy student-friendly prices wherever you go.

Related: How Do I Resolve A Conflict with my College Roommate?

Planning to move to Omaha for your University? Here are some places that you should check out.

  • Creighton University
  • University of Nebraska
  • Clarkson College
  • College of Saint Mary
  • Creative Centre: College of Art and Design

How Transit Friendly is Omaha?

While Omaha is a walkable city, public transit could use a little more help. It isn’t necessary to own a car to live in the city, but you would probably have an easier time if you had one. If you’re moving to the city for work, try to find rooms for rent in Omaha that are closer to your workplace.

1. Walkability in Omaha

Omaha is the 23rd most walkable large city in the US. Some of the most walkable neighborhoods are Park East, Market West and Old Market. if you like to get some fresh air by walking around the block, to look for rooms for rent in these Omaha neighborhoods.

2. Roads/traffic in Omaha

Planning to get to your appointments just in the nick of time? Omaha traffic is not your friend. While Omaha traffic has never been great, it seems to be getting worse every year. When you have to make it to events, make sure your account for traffic even during non-peak hours.

3. Taxis in Omaha

You won’t have any shortage of taxi services in Omaha. Omaha taxis charge a base fare of $3.50 with an additional $3.55 for every kilometre, and a waiting fare of $35 per hour. Most hotels in the city also offer complimentary rides to and from the airport. If you’d rather not wait to hail a taxi, you can opt for online options like Uber and Lyft. Environmentally conscious residents can also opt for ride share programs that service the city.

4. Public transportation in Omaha

Apart from rental cars, limos and shuttles, residents can also opt for the extensive bus routes throughout the city. Operated by the Omaha Metro, the bus service is Omaha’s primary mass transit system. Hence, most people opt for rental services if they are visiting the city for a few days.

5. Airports in Omaha

Eppley Airport provides non-stop service to 26 destinations and handles over 200 flights per day. Though it is a mid-sized airport, in 2016, it ranked first in customer satisfaction. Located just a 10-minute drive from Downtown Omaha, you can drive into the heart of the city in no time.

6. Cycling in Omaha

The League of American Bicyclists renewed Omaha’s status as Bronze Level Bicycle Friendly Community in 2019 for another four years. The city has continually invested in bike-friendly infrastructure to make roads safer for all. A 38-mile unifying bike trail along with Omaha’s growing bike share services has ensured that Omaha continues to improve its Bike Friendly Community status.

Restaurants in Omaha

Exploring a new city is all about discovering staple dishes that locals cannot get enough of. Learning about the old joints that have been serving residents for years to exploring up-and-coming food joints, Omaha is a treasure trove for foodies. From Poutine Burritos, and the Runza to the Wagyu Burger and the Big Daddy Chocolate cake, the endless list of delicious treats will keep you busy.

  • V. Mertz
  • La Buvette
  • The Boiler Room

Historical/Cultural Spots in Omaha

The hometown of Civil Rights leader Malcolm X and US President Gerald Ford, Omaha has no shortage of cultural and historical spots. From the 20th century passenger trains that you can explore in The Durham Museum, to the Mormon Trail Centre that commemorates the struggles of the Mormon Migration and their triumph in 1846. Visit the home of General George Crook, a prominent military officer during the American Civil War, or explore the famed Boys Town founded by Father Flanagan in 1917.

We’ve got you!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Omaha? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

Download the app now!
